definition[0]: used to show that you are disappointed about something and you wish things could happen differently
example[1]: It’s a pity that he didn’t accept the job.
example[2]: It’s a great pity Joyce wasn’t invited.
example[3]: I like Charlie. Pity he had to marry that awful woman.
example[4]: A pity we can’t find the guy who did it.
example[5]: It would be a pity to give up now – you’ve nearly finished.
note[2]: it’s a pity to do something
